data.title: Famous Birthdays on February 5
data.meta_description: Famous birthdays for the 5th of February. See which celebrities, historical figures, scientists and criminals were born on February 5.
data.text:
Birthdays 1 - 200 of 254

Sanjō, 67th Emperor of Japan (1011-16), born in Kyōto, Japan (d. 1017)

Aegidius Tschudi, Swiss historian (d. 1572)

René of Châlon, (d. 1544)

Giovanni de' Bardi, Italian writer (d. 1612)

Esteban Manuel de Villegas, Spanish poet (d. 1669)

1589 Honorat de Brueil seigneur de Racan, French aristocrat playwright and poet, born in Aubigné-Racan, France (d. 1670)

Gaspar Schott, German mathematician (d. 1666)

Marie de Rabutin-Chantal, marquise de Sévigné, French author famous for her letter-writing, born in Paris (d. 1696)

Giuseppe Vignola, Italian composer, born in Napoli, Habsburg Spain (d. 1712)

Gilbert Tennent, Irish-born religious leader (d. 1764)

Joseph Umstatt, Austrian composer, born in Vienna, Archduchy of Austria, Holy Roman Empire (d. 1762)

John Witherspoon

Scottish-American president of the College of New Jersey who signed the Declaration of Independence, born in Gifford, Scotland

James Otis, American lawyer and patriot, born in Barnstable, Massachusetts (d. 1783)

Nathanael Gottfried Gruner, German composer (Kantor at Gera), born in Zwickau, Electorate of Saxony, Holy Roman Empire (d. 1792)

John Jeffries, American physician and meteorologist (1st balloon flight across English Channel), born in Boston, Massachusetts (d. 1819)

Christian Gottlob Neefe, German composer, conductor and tutor of Ludwig van Beethoven, born in Shimnitz, Electorate of Saxony, Holy Roman Empire (d. 1798)

Court Lambertus van Beyma, Frisian regent and leader of the Frisian patriots (d. 1820)

Alexandre Brongniart, French geologist and mineralogist (arranged geologic formations of the Tertiary Period), born in Paris, France (d. 1847)

Margaretha Jacoba de Neufville, Dutch author (De Schildknaap - 1st Dutch historical novel) (d. 1856)

Nancy Hanks Lincoln, mother of Abraham Lincoln, born in Hampshire County, West Virginia (d. 1818)

Karoly Kisfaludy, Hungarian pioneering dramatist (A Tat rok Magyarorsz gon), born in Tét, Hungary (d. 1830)

Robert Peel

British Prime Minister (Tory/Conservative/Peelite: 1834-35; 1841-46), founder of the British Conservative Party and the modern police force (Bobbies), born in Bury, Lancashire, England

Wilhelm Karl Ritter von Haidinger, Austrian mineralogist (d. 1871)

John Lindley, English botanist (Elements of Botany), born in Catton, England (d. 1865)

Johan Ludvig Runeberg, Finnish poet (Finland's national anthem "Maamme"), born in Jakobstad, Finland (d. 1877)

Carl Spitzweg, German painter (d. 1885)

Ole Bull, Norwegian violin virtuoso and compsoer, born in Bergen, Norway (d. 1880)

Dwight Lyman Moody, American evangelist (Moody Church), born in Northfield, Massachusetts (d. 1899)

Hiram Maxim, American-British inventor (Maxim gun, 1st automatic machine gun), born in Sangerville, Maine (d. 1916)

1840 John Boyd Dunlop, Scottish vet and inventor (pneumatic rubber tire), born in Dreghorn, Scotland (d. 1888)

Belle Starr [Myra Belle Shirley] American outlaw (American wild west), born in Carthage, Missouri (d. 1889)

1848 Ignacio Carrera Pinto, Chilean war hero (d. 1882)

1848 Joris-Karl Huysmans, French writer (Against the Grain), born in Paris, France (d. 1907)

Terauchi Masatake, Japanese soldier and politician (Prime Minister of Japan 1916-18), born in Hirai Village, Japan (d. 1919)

Otto Brahm, German critic, theatre director (founded Neue Deutsche Rundschau), born in Hamburg (d. 1912)

Felipe Villanueva y Gutierrez, Mexican composer and violinist of the Porfiriato period, born in Tecámac, Mexico (d. 1893)

Armand Parent, Belgian violinist and composer, born in Liège, Belgium (d. 1934)

Carl Teike, German military composer, born in Stettin-Altdamm, Pomerania (now Szczecin, Poland) (d. 1922)

Harvey Worthington Loomis, American composer (Lyrics of the Red Man), born in Brooklyn, New York (d. 1930)

Arthur Keith, Scottish anthropologist (human evolution), born in Persley Aberdeenshire (d. 1955)

1866 Rossetter Gleason Cole, American composer (Heroes of Freedom), born in Clyde, Michigan (d. 1952)

Lodewijk Mortelmans, Belgian composer (Morgenstemming - Morning Mood), born in Antwerp, Belgium (d. 1952)

André Citroën

French automobile pioneer, born in Paris, France

Frederick Lonsdale, British playwright (Balkan Princess), born in St Helier, Jersey (d. 1954)

Al Worthington, baseball player
